arts.ttl: Arsenal star dedicates Leicester win to wife after embarrassing Valentine's Day blunder
arts.sum: Arsenal felt the love against Leicester on Saturday as they beat the Foxes 2-0 but one Gunners star had some serious making up to after forgetting all about Valentine’s Day

arts.ttl: Ruud van Nistelrooy provides early James Justin injury update after Leicester City scare
arts.sum: Leicester City boss Ruud van Nistelrooy has confirmed that James Justin will be assessed on Sunday after being forced off in the first half against Arsenal on Saturday. After the loss, van Nistelrooy was asked about the immediate assessment of the defender's injury.

arts.ttl: Results will come for Leicester - Van Nistelrooy
arts.sum: Leicester City boss Ruud van Nistelrooy believes his side will start to win matches if his side continue to perform like they did in the Foxes' 2-0 defeat at home to Arsenal.

arts.ttl: Martin Keown apologises to Ruud van Nistelrooy - 22 years after infamous bust-up
arts.sum: The Arsenal legend and former Manchester United striker caught up before Leicester's 2-0 defeat to the Gunners on Saturday, where Keown was working for TNT Sports and Van Nistelrooy was managing the Foxes

arts.ttl: Leicester ratings v Arsenal as trio stand out with hearts broken by late defeat
arts.sum: City did think they had a goal when Jordan Ayew surged down the left and crossed low and hard to the back post, Bobby De Cordova-Reid ready to tap in. The best chance of the half came in added time when Kristiansen swung in a perfect cross for Ndidi to attack, the Nigerian planting his free header wide from 10 yards out.

arts.ttl: Super sub Mikel Merino’s double keeps Arsenal in the title chase
arts.sum: A makeshift front-line failed to work for the Gunners until Merino came off the bench at Leicester.

arts.ttl: Martin Keown apologises to Ruud van Nistelrooy for his iconic Battle of Old Trafford 'shenanigans' in 2003 - as former rivals endure awkward reunion ahead of Leicester's clash with Arsenal
arts.sum: Martin Keown issued an apology to Ruud van Nistelrooy for his 'shenanigans' at the 'Battle of Old Trafford' in 2003, ahead of Arsenal's game against Leicester on Saturday afternoon.

arts.ttl: Leicester City team news v Arsenal as two changes made but Caleb Okoli keeps place
arts.sum: Caleb Okoli has kept his place in the Leicester City starting line-up with Ruud van Nistelrooy making just two changes for the Premier League fixture against Arsenal. Okoli made his first start under van Nistelrooy in City's FA Cup loss at Manchester United, replacing the injured Jannik Vestergaard, and produced a decent performance.

arts.ttl: Leicester City need plan of action for 13 players this summer
arts.sum: Of course, City could wait to see how players perform in the 25-26 campaign and then make a decision on their futures, but by then they will be at risk of other clubs offering them contracts. But what’s making this summer an especially busy one is not those players in the final few months’ of their contracts, but those whose deals expire in 2026.

arts.ttl: How to watch Leicester City vs Arsenal - TV channel, live stream, kick-off time
arts.sum: It's a game that's been described as a "free hit" for Leicester City, one that no-one expects the Premier League strugglers to draw, let alone win. You could argue that is what happened when Leicester played Tottenham last month - their one win in nine league games - and what their supporters will be praying can happen again today at the King Power Stadium.
